page.title: 01OUR AREA
page.content: The area surveyed by our schools is in the South-West of Northamptonshire,a few miles to the east of the market town of Banbury,which lies across the county border in Oxfordshire.It is a mainly rural area,containing several small to medium sized farms of an average of two hundred acres,but also the village of Middleton Cheney lies at the centre of the square. To the west of the square is a series of hills which form part of the Cherwell Valley,but the land flattens out to the east.The soil is quite heavy and red in colour,containing clay and ironstone. Middleton Cheney is an old village and most of the buildings in the centre are made of stone.However the area is expandng as new housing estates are being built.The population of the village is about three thousand.
